hanzi-su-wiki:
稿

Значения

Рукопись

Мнемоника

Высокая 高 часть злаковых 禾 растений — солома. В более широком смысле — необмолоченный, неотделанный, черновой, рукопись.

Варианты

稾, 藁

gǎo
manuscript; draft; stalk of grain
рукопись; проект; стебель зерна
rtega_mnemonic:
稿稿RS槁稁稾藁藳draft, manuscript, rough copy, straw, stalk
  • tall 高 grain 禾艹: straw will be made of it and manuscripts will have to wait to be finished until the harvest is done
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 高 indicates the sound; 禾 (grain) conveys the meaning.

发稿 [ fā gǎo ]: (of a publisher) to send a manuscript off to the printer; (of a journalist) to send a dispatch
文稿 [ wén gǎo ]: manuscript; article (in newspaper); draft

heisig_chinese_memo: You draft plans to create tall wheat. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: draft, wheat, cereal, tall, top hat, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2
heisig_story: The key word connotes the preliminary composition of a plan or manuscript. Its elements: wheat . . . tall.
koohiiStory1: The first DRAFT of catcher in the rye was actually called "catcher in the TALL WHEAT"...good thing they changed it. I read it in 高校.
koohiiStory2: Aliens often draft their plans for invasion by cutting designs among the tall wheat.
jp_example_words: 原稿(げんこう): manuscript, copy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When what you're writing is as tall as the grains growing outside, you know you're done with your first draft. Some teachers want papers to be a certain number of words or pages, but that's silly. You should measure your draft in grains!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine holding your draft up outside in a field of grains. You're a couple leaves short. Time to get back to the drawing board.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who asked you to write such a tall draft in the first place? Emperor こういち, who wants you to draft up the world's largest book about how great of an emperor he is.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now こういち is out there measuring your draft against the tall grain plants. You better hope it's long enough, because if it isn't, Emperor こういち's probably going to execute you.
Ru_Notes:
Не путать: 橋 (はし、キョウ мост).
したがき: чаще 下書き.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: it takes expensive (高) grain (禾) to buy manuscript
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You draft plans to create tall wheat. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From " He ", the sound of " high " means stalks, which is also called " Yi ". "Ji Yun": "Drafts, stalks." "The Biography of Yan Dian History" by Chang Heng Shao of the Qing Dynasty: "Ying Yuan should take the dark night and put together the manuscript as a person."

" Drafts " can refer to the cursive foundations of poems, pictures, etc., as well as written articles and works. "Old Tang Book-The Biography of Gao Shilian": "Since Shilian met Yilong, he performed many performances and burned manuscripts, and no one knew it."

" Draft " also refers to plans and plans. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 62: "He has a draft in his heart, and he has a clue."

" Draft " also refers to the appearance and appearance. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion‧Photo": "Yi Xian once laughed at the same time, wait for the imagination to describe it, and then fill in the details, then the girl is afraid of leaking the style manuscript."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " Wo ", " high " sound to indicate straw, but also for " and Gao ."
humanum_full_description:
從「禾」，「高」聲，表示禾稈，也作「稾」。《集韻》：「稿，秆也。」清邵長蘅《閻典史傳》：「應元乘黑夜，束稿為人。」

　　「稿」可指詩文、圖畫等的草底，亦指寫成的文章、著作。《舊唐書‧高士廉傳》：「士廉既任遇益隆，多所表奏，成輒焚稿，人莫知之。」

　　「稿」還指計劃、打算。《紅樓夢》第62回：「他心裏已有了稿兒，自有頭緒。」

　　「稿」也指樣子、模樣。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧寫真》：「有一箇曾同笑，待想像生描著，再消詳邈(描)入其中妙，則女孩家怕漏泄風情稿。」
humanum_short_description: 從「禾」，「高」聲，表示禾稈，也作「稾」。

原稿(げんこう): manuscript, copy

從「 禾 」，「 高 」聲，表示禾稈，也作「 稾 」。《集韻》：「稿，秆也。」清邵長蘅《閻典史傳》：「應元乘黑夜，束稿為人。」 「 稿 」可指詩文、圖畫等的草底，亦指寫成的文章、著作。《舊唐書‧高士廉傳》：「士廉既任遇益隆，多所表奏，成輒焚稿，人莫知之。」 「 稿 」還指計劃、打算。《紅樓夢》第62回：「他心裏已有了稿兒，自有頭緒。」 「 稿 」也指樣子、模樣。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧寫真》：「有一箇曾同笑，待想像生描著，再消詳邈(描)入其中妙，則女孩家怕漏泄風情稿。」
From " He", the sound of " high" means stalks, which is also called " Yi". "Ji Yun": "Drafts, stalks." "The Biography of Yan Dian History" by Chang Heng Shao of the Qing Dynasty: "Ying Yuan should take the dark night and put together the manuscript as a person." " Drafts" can refer to the cursive foundations of poems, pictures, etc., as well as written articles and works. "Old Tang Book-The Biography of Gao Shilian": "Since Shilian met Yilong, he performed many performances and burned manuscripts, and no one knew it." " Draft" also refers to plans and plans. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 62: "He has a draft in his heart, and he has a clue." " Draft" also refers to the appearance and appearance. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion‧Photo": "Yi Xian once laughed at the same time, wait for the imagination to describe it, and then fill in the details, then the girl is afraid of leaking the style manuscript."

稿字的基本解释

稿
gǎo
谷类植物的茎秆：稿秆。稿荐（稻草编的垫子）。
文字、图画的草底，又喻事先考虑的计划：文稿。稿本。稿件。讲稿。

稿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gǎo］
［《集韻》居勞切，平，見。］
(1)同“稾”。禾秆。
(2)同“稾”。诗文、图画等的草底。亦指写成的文章、著作。
(3)指计划；打算。
(4)样子；模样。
(5)用同“搞”。
(6)通“槁”。枯槁。

稿字的英文翻译

◎ 稿
draft, manuscript, sketch, straw

稿字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【禾字部】　稿； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页858第04
【正字通】同稾。

稿字的源字形

稿字的起名意思

指稻、麦等植物的茎秆。后也指文字、图画等的草稿底子。

draft
Basic explanation of words
draft
gǎo
The stalk of cereal plants: draft stalk. Manuscript recommendation (mat made of straw).
The cursive background of the text and pictures is also a metaphor for the plan considered in advance: the manuscript. Manuscript. Manuscript. Lecture.
draft
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［gǎo］
["Ji Yun" Ju Laoqie, Ping , see you. ]
(1) Same as "Ji". Straw.
(2) Same as "Ji". Grass bottom of poems, pictures, etc. It also refers to written articles and works.
(3) Refers to plan; plan.
(4) Appearance; appearance.
(5) Use the same "engage".
(6) Through "槁". withered.

gǎo

1) солома; соломенный
禾稿 рисовая солома
稿席 соломенный мат (циновка)
2) черновик, рукопись (напр. статьи); эскиз, набросок (картины)
投稿 присылать рукописи
弃稿 выбросить черновик (набросок)

3) трафарет; оттиск
准稿儿 готовый эталон, трафарет
II гл.
устар. вм. 搞
Radicals: 禾, 高  (grain, tall)
Meaning Mnemonic
When what you're writing is as tall as the grains growing outside, you know you're done with your first draft. Some teachers want papers to be a certain number of words or pages, but that's silly. You should measure your draft in grains!
Imagine holding your draft up outside in a field of grains. You're a couple leaves short. Time to get back to the drawing board.
Reading Mnemonic
Who asked you to write such a tall draft in the first place? Emperor こういち, who wants you to draft up the world's largest book about how great of an emperor he is.
Now こういち is out there measuring your draft against the tall grain plants. You better hope it's long enough, because if it isn't, Emperor こういち's probably going to execute you.
